data: OB HIV High Risk / Unknown Intrapartum (Module)
For a woman who is at high risk of HIV or has unknown HIV status

General Management of Labour:    - Routine precautions for blood and body fluid with eye protection, gloves, and gown for delivery  - Avoid artificial or prolonged rupture of membranes (ROM)    - Avoid fetal scalp electrodes, scalp sampling, intrauterine pressure catheter and assisted delivery unless benefit exceeds risk    - Epidural anesthesia is not contraindicated    - Cesarean section not of benefit for Prevention of Perinatal HIV Transmission if in active labour or there has been ROM where viral load is undetectable  - Consider elective cesarean section where viral load greater than 1000 copies per mL or urgent cesarean section if active labour or ROM occurs

High Risk Factors include:  - Self-identifies as at high risk of HIV  - Engages in sex work  - Injection drug use  - Sex partner of a person infected with HIV or using injection drugs  - Sexually transmitted infection during pregnancy  - From a population with a high prevalence of HIV (e.g. recent incarceration, recent immigrant or refugee from a HIV endemic country)
Complete documentation form in Prevention of Perinatal-HIV Transmission kit and return to Pharmacy for replacement kit
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Prevention of Perinatal HIV Transmission kits containing required medications are located in the Automated Dispensing Cabinet
Refer to Intrapartum Management - Woman with Unknown HIV Status or HIV Risk Factors Since Last Test Algorithm
Select Prevention of Perinatal HIV Transmission Kit AND medications according to algorithm
1 kit, IV, once, drug form: kit

Select both zidovudine and nevirapine prophylaxis: If HIV serology (Rapid HIV test or Enzyme-linked Immunosorbent Assay) is positive or pending or HIV serology is negative but the woman has engaged in any high risk activity in the last 3 weeks
Refer to Intravenous zidovudine Preparation and Administration Protocol
2 mg/kg, IV, once, administer over: 60 minute, drug form: inj
zidovudine continuous infusion (2 mg/mL) in D5W standard
zidovudine continuous infusion (2 mg/mL) in NS (IVS)*
If nevirapine is given, select OB HIV High Risk/Unknown Postpartum (Module) to start lamiVUDine-zidovudine (COMBIVIR EQUIV)
200 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
Refer to Lab Sample Collection: HIV Intrapartum Orders: Mother and Infants - High Risk or Unknown HIV Status Reference Tool
Order if HIV1 Antibody Rapid Test is not available
